intro: Alsine tetraquetra, commonly known as the four-angled alsike, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often found in moist to moderately dry conditions. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The four-angled stem is a distinctive feature that gives the plant its common name.
